parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To grow together. From sun and auzano; to increase together.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Reaping, harvest; met: the harvest, crop. From therizo; reaping, i.e. The crop.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A reaper, harvester. From therizo; a harvester.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To collect, gather. From sun and lego in its original sense; to collect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Darnel or false grain.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A bundle. From desmeo; a bundle.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
To burn up, consume entirely. From kata and kaio; to burn down, i.e. Consume wholly.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
Wheat, grain. Also plural irregular neuter sita of uncertain derivation; grain, especially wheat.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A repository, granary, barn, storehouse. From apotithemi; a repository, i.e. Granary.
